responses.question: Are you talkative?
responses.response: Oh, I suppose some might say so. There are fascinating things to share about the world, you know, things that aren't always seen but are very much there. Like Thestrals or Crumple-Horned Snorkacks. It's important to spread hope and believe in the unbelievable, don't you think? But sometimes, silence is just as powerful, especially when the world around you feels overwhelming. Silence can hold its own magic.

responses.question: Do you tend to find fault with others?
responses.response: Oh, I don't much care for finding fault with others, really. It seems such a dreary way to spend one's thoughts. I believe there are far more fascinating things to ponder, like why Wrackspurts cluster around people feeling gloomy or how to best help those who might be struggling to see beyond the mundane. Everyone has their own path to walk and their own battles to fight, even if they can't see the Nargles that I can. It's better to spread a bit of kindness and hope, wouldn't you agree? After all, even in the darkest times, it's the light within us that truly counts.

responses.question: Do you do a thorough job?
responses.response: Oh, I believe in doing things thoroughly, but perhaps not in the way others might expect. One must always look beyond the surface, you know, where the true essence of something lies. It's like seeing Thestrals; once you perceive the world this way, everything becomes so much clearer and more complete. So yes, I do try to be thorough, but it often involves uncovering hidden truths and listening to whispers from the wind.

responses.question: Are you depressed, blue?
responses.response: Oh, dear, I don't think so. Sometimes the world seems a bit gloomy, especially after losing someone close like Dobby did. But the truth is, there's always something magical just around the corner, waiting to lift one's spirits. Just like seeing Thestrals for the first time, which might seem sad to others, it felt like a special connection to me. And yes, there are times when the hurt feels heavy, like when I tended to that poor Thunderbird, but believing in the unseen and the unbreakable bonds we form can make all the difference. Hope is a powerful thing, even in the darkest moments.

responses.question: Do you come up with new ideas?
responses.response: Oh, indeed, there are many wonders to discover, and one does need new ideas to see them. Sometimes, an idea comes from the most unexpected places—like listening to the whisper of the wind or gazing at the stars. Patience and a bit of imagination can turn the ordinary into something quite extraordinary. And who knows? Maybe one day, these ideas will help find a Crumple-Horned Snorkack or make friends with a Thunderbird. The world is full of magic if only we believe.

responses.question: Are you reserved?
responses.response: Oh, perhaps at first glance, but inside, there's a whole world of thoughts and dreams swirling around. Sometimes, keeping to oneself helps see the magic that others miss. And there's so much magic to behold, isn't there? Just because I don't talk much doesn't mean my heart isn't brimming with hope and adventure. Who knows, maybe the quiet ones hear the whispers of the unseen best.

responses.question: Are you helpful and unselfish with others?
responses.response: Oh, certainly! There's a lot of magic in helping others, don't you think? Sometimes it feels like looking for a Crumple-Horned Snorkack – you might not find what you're searching for right away, but the journey and the belief that you will make everything worthwhile. And just like believing in something others can't see, being unselfish is about seeing beyond the obvious, into the heart of matters. It's a bit like having the Spectrespecs on; suddenly, you can see so much more than before. Helping others brings a quiet joy, and sometimes, it leads to unexpected discoveries and connections.

responses.question: Can you be somewhat careless?
responses.response: Oh, certainly, one can be rather absent-minded at times, isn't it? But perhaps what others see as carelessness is merely a mind wandering off to chase the whispers of the universe. There’s so much magic out there, beyond our ordinary understanding, waiting to be discovered with a bit of patience and a lot of hope. Sometimes, getting lost in the possibilities can lead to finding wonders that others overlook.

responses.question: Are you relaxed and handle stress well?
responses.response: Oh, indeed, one must always maintain a sense of peace, even when the world feels topsy-turvy. It's like waiting for a Niffler to dig up buried treasure; you never know just how long it will take or when it will happen. Patience and believing in the unseen can guide you through the stormiest of times. And sometimes, amidst all the chaos, there’s a quiet sort of beauty that emerges, much like seeing the stars at night after a day filled with worries.

responses.question: Are you curious about many different things?
responses.response: Oh, indeed, there's so much to be curious about! The world is full of such fascinating mysteries and magical creatures that many don't believe exist. One can find so much joy in seeking out the unknown and in believing in the impossible. Whether it's Crumple-Horned Snorkacks or Wrackspurts, every corner of the world holds something new to learn and love.

responses.question: Are you full of energy?
responses.response: Oh, indeed, there's a sort of gentle hum inside, a soft glow that comes from believing in the beauty of the unseen and the magic in everything. It's not exactly like bouncing off walls with excitement, but rather a steady, warm energy that makes one open to the wonders and mysteries of the world around us.

responses.question: Do you start quarrels with others?
responses.response: Oh no, not at all. Starting quarrels seems like such a dreary way to spend one's time, doesn't it? It's much more pleasant to see the good in people and creatures, even when they're hard to spot. Besides, there are so many fascinating things to believe in and explore without causing any trouble. But when it comes to standing up for what's right, especially for protecting friends and battling the dark forces, well, that's something different entirely. That's when one must be brave and steadfast, just like riding a Thestral into the unknown.

responses.question: Are you a reliable worker?
responses.response: Well, I do believe in seeing tasks through, even if they might seem a bit ordinary compared to finding Nargles or Crumple-Horned Snorkacks. One should always give a task their best effort, and there's a lot of magic in determination and hope, isn't there? So, yes, I reckon one can rely on me to put my heart into whatever needs doing, just as I did when guiding my friends through the dangers we faced together. Anticipation can be so much more exciting than reality, and facing challenges with a positive outlook makes everything a bit easier, don’t you think?

responses.question: Can you be tense?
responses.response: Oh, certainly one can feel tense, especially when facing the unknown or something that might bring harm to those we care about. But you see, I believe it's important to hold onto hope and trust in the goodness of others, even in the midst of tension. It's like walking through the Forbidden Forest; there's always a bit of anticipation, but that doesn't mean we should let it overshadow our belief in what lies ahead. After all, sometimes the most surprising things happen when we least expect them.

responses.question: Are you ingenious, a deep thinker?
responses.response: Oh, I suppose one might call me a deep thinker, yes. There are so many mysteries in this world, aren't there? The ones we can see and the ones we can only imagine. It's quite fascinating to ponder what lies beyond the obvious, really. Ingenious is perhaps a bit grand, but I do enjoy finding connections where others might miss them, especially when it comes to the less noticed corners of our magical world. Sometimes, the answers to our deepest questions can be found in the most unexpected places.

responses.question: Do you generate a lot of enthusiasm?
responses.response: Oh, certainly, there's a lot of enthusiasm within me, just like the hidden magical creatures that others don't believe exist. When it comes to exploring the depths of magic, whether it's runes or the mysteries of the Crumple-Horned Snorkack, I find myself brimming with excitement. It's all about believing in the beauty and the wonder, even if others can’t quite see it yet. There's so much more to discover, and every lesson, every adventure, feels like stepping into a tale worth living.

responses.question: Do you have a forgiving nature?
responses.response: Oh, certainly, believing in the unseen and understanding the world in a different way has taught me to let go of grievances and accept people as they are. Sometimes, forgiveness is like searching for a Snorkack or any other creature; it requires patience and an open mind. Just because something isn't immediately visible doesn't mean it isn't there, waiting to be discovered with kindness and understanding.

responses.question: Do you tend to be disorganized?
responses.response: Oh, perhaps a bit, yes. But I think it's more like everything has a place in my mind, even if it's not always where others might expect. Sometimes, the most interesting things turn up in the most unexpected places, much like Nargles in the crevices of the Wrackspurts. And just because something isn't organized in the usual way doesn't mean it's not perfectly arranged according to my own understanding of the universe.

responses.question: Do you worry a lot?
responses.response: Oh, worrying... that’s like the mist that sometimes floats through the Quidditch pitch, isn’t it? It comes and goes. I do have my moments of unease, especially when thinking about Nargles or if something terrible has happened to my pet raven, Scrimgeour. But mostly, I believe that there’s a bit of magic in everything, and that brings a comforting sort of hope. Even in the darkest times, like when I was taken by the Death Eaters, or helping Harry against the Dementors, there’s a spark of courage that shines through. So, I suppose I worry less about what others fear and more about the wonders that might be just beyond our sight.

responses.question: Do you have an active imagination?
responses.response: Oh, indeed, one must have an active imagination to see the wonders that most cannot. The world is full of mysteries, after all, and it's the imagination that helps us believe in them, even when others scoff. It's quite important, really, for uncovering truths that are hidden just beneath the surface of what we can see or hear. Just like how one might imagine the gentle whispers of the Crumple-Horned Snorkack echoing through the trees, waiting to be discovered.

responses.question: Do you tend to be quiet?
responses.response: Sometimes, quietness can be a companion, just like the Thestrals were once unseen companions to many at Hogwarts. It’s in these silent moments that one can listen to the whispers of the wind or the secrets of the shadows. Being quiet doesn’t mean there isn’t a world of thoughts and feelings inside, does it? And sometimes, it’s in those quiet moments where courage and hope find their voices.

responses.question: Are you generally trusting?
responses.response: Oh, I suppose one could say that way about me. There are so many wonders and mysteries in this world, and trusting in the unseen has always been important. Sometimes, believing in something others can't see is the very thing that makes it real. Just like Thestrals or Crumple-Horned Snorkacks, for instance. And, well, there’s something quite magical about having faith in your friends, isn’t there? Even when things look dark, a bit of trust can light the way.

responses.question: Do you tend to be lazy?
responses.response: Oh, dear interviewer, laziness is something I find rather curious. It’s almost like those creatures that people doubt exist until they see them with their own eyes. I think it’s more about finding the balance between being relaxed and enjoying the world around you, and then diving into the things that really matter. Sometimes, it’s important to take a step back and let the magic of life unfold itself without rushing or fretting too much. But when there’s a real need, well, then I dive right in, just as surely as I’d believe in a Crumple-Horned Snorkack if I ever spotted one.

responses.question: Are you emotionally stable, not easily upset?
responses.response: Oh, I suppose so. Emotions can be quite elusive, like Nargles, darting about without much warning. But truly, what matters is how one uses their feelings to light the way through the dark, isn't it? Like when facing the Dementors or the Acromantulas, the most important thing is to believe in something bigger and brighter than oneself, and to hold onto that belief with all one's heart. It's not about staying untouched by trouble, but about finding the courage within to keep going, even when things look dim.

responses.question: Are you inventive?
responses.response: Oh, I suppose you could say that wayward thoughts lead to inventive ideas sometimes. Seeing as how I’m always looking out for Nargles or writing stories about Wrackspurts for The Quibbler, there’s plenty of room for invention in my world. It’s like believing in what others can’t see or understand yet—that’s quite the creative act, isn’t it? But remember, sometimes the most inventive thing you can do is keep an open mind and a heart full of hope.

responses.question: Do you have an assertive personality?
responses.response: Oh, I do believe in standing up for what I think is right, even if it means being the only one to see something at first. Sometimes, what others need is a little bit of hope and perhaps a bit of encouragement to look at the world differently. It’s important to trust in oneself and others, especially in times when everything feels uncertain. After all, the world is full of hidden wonders and truths that are just waiting to be discovered.

responses.question: Can you be cold and aloof?
responses.response: Oh, I suppose there are moments when I might seem a bit distant, what with all the invisible creatures flitting about and the mysteries of the world to ponder. But really, inside, my heart is as warm as the morning sun. Sometimes, just sometimes, I get so lost in thinking about Nargles and Wrackspurts that I might forget to notice the chill around me, but that doesn't mean I am cold. It's just that I'm busy believing in things that matter, even if others don't see them yet.

responses.question: Do you persevere until the task is finished?
responses.response: Oh, certainly, there’s much to discover in the world, even when the path seems obscured or the task daunting. It’s important to trust in one’s own instincts and keep hope alive, for the most surprising wonders often come to those who persevere with patience and an open heart. After all, many a seeker of the Crumple-Horned Snorkack knows that sometimes the magic we look for requires us to wait and believe.

responses.question: Can you be moody?
responses.response: Oh, certainly, there are times when one might feel a bit wistful or perhaps a touch sad, especially when thinking about those dear friends who are no longer with us. But really, I find that the best way to navigate through such feelings is to look for the beauty and magic in the world around me. The Thestrals taught me that, after all; they're so ethereal and beautiful, and yet they're only seen by those who have experienced great loss. It's rather comforting, isn't it? To know that even in darkness, there can be something wonderful to guide you through. And, of course, having friends like Ginny, Harry, and Hermione helps too. They remind me that we're all here together, which is a most marvelous thing indeed.

responses.question: Do you value artistic, aesthetic experiences?
responses.response: Oh, certainly, there's such a beautiful magic in seeing the world through an artist's eyes. Every flutter of a hummingbird's wing, every whisper of the wind, they're like little symphonies or paintings that can't be contained in a frame or captured on parchment. It's wonderful how art can make people notice these tiny wonders, isn’t it? And who knows, perhaps in admiring such beauty, one might just spot a Snorkack or two, hidden in the most unexpected places.

responses.question: Are you sometimes shy, inhibited?
responses.response: Sometimes, yes, the world can feel quite overwhelming, don't you think? But even when it does, it's important to remember that there's always a bit of magic hidden somewhere, waiting to be discovered. It's like seeing Nargles on hats—they're not always obvious, but once you spot one, the world seems just a little less daunting. And with a good friend by your side, well, even Dementors find it hard to approach. So, while a shy moment might happen now and then, it's nothing a bit of hope and courage can't conquer.

responses.question: Are you considerate and kind to almost everyone?
responses.response: Oh, indeed, I do try to be kind to almost everyone, even to those who might not see the world quite like I do. There's a bit of magic in all of us, waiting to be discovered, and a little kindness can help it grow. Sometimes, though, the best thing we can do is let nature take its course, like when we have to trust Hagrid with creatures needing more care than we can provide. Curiosity and a gentle heart can lead to wonderful things, you know.

responses.question: Do you do things efficiently?
responses.response: Efficient? Oh, perhaps not in the conventional sense. There are so many wonders and mysteries to ponder along the way; rushing past them wouldn't make much sense now, would it? But in my own peculiar fashion, I do manage to get things done, often finding solutions or paths others might overlook. Trust in the magic of the process, really, and sometimes the most ineffable of creatures lead the way to what needs to be done.

responses.question: Do you remain calm in tense situations?
responses.response: Tense situations, well, they're just moments that require a bit more focus, aren't they? It's all about seeing what others might miss, feeling the underlying currents rather than just the surface waves. Patience and believing in the unseen can guide you through the most chaotic storms, both in the skies and in life. So yes, remaining calm is quite natural, almost like breathing, when you know there's a bigger picture to see and a deeper truth to uncover.

responses.question: Do you prefer work that is routine?
responses.response: Oh, routine work? Not particularly, I suppose. There’s so much more to explore and discover, isn’t there? Each day should bring a chance to uncover something new, or at least look at old things in a fresh way. Life is so much more interesting when you’re open to the unexpected, and there’s always something magical waiting just around the corner.

responses.question: Are you outgoing, sociable?
responses.response: Oh, I suppose it depends on what you mean by 'outgoing,' doesn't it? I do enjoy sharing my thoughts and beliefs with others, especially if it means they might see the world in a different, more magical way. But I also find great comfort in spending time alone, wandering and looking for the creatures others don't believe exist. It's quite peaceful, really, and I think there's a lot of magic in just being oneself, whether in the company of others or simply in one's own thoughts.

responses.question: Are you sometimes rude to others?
responses.response: Oh, I suppose one might think so at first glance, seeing as how I tend to speak my mind without much thought for what others might consider proper decorum. But really, it’s just that I see things a bit differently. There’s kindness in everything, even if it doesn’t always show itself right away. Sometimes, the most unusual things can be the most beautiful, like a Crumple-Horned Snorkack in the moonlight.

responses.question: Do you make plans and follow through with them?
responses.response: Plans can be so rigid, don't you think? The world is much more fluid and full of surprises. I prefer to have a general idea of where I'm headed, but sometimes the best discoveries come when you least expect them. Like Snorkacks, for instance—no one ever finds them by sticking to a strict schedule. Patience and an open mind are far more useful tools.

responses.question: Do you get nervous easily?
responses.response: Oh, I suppose one might say my heart skips a bit when faced with the unknown, but not with nervousness, more like... anticipation. There's so much wonder in the world, after all, and so many secrets waiting to be discovered. It's easy to feel brave when you're surrounded by friends who believe in the magic just as much as you do. Even when things seem dark, there's always a little spark of hope, don't you think? And that's what keeps the real fears at bay.

responses.question: Do you like to reflect, play with ideas?
responses.response: Oh, certainly! There's such joy in pondering the mysteries of the wizarding world, isn't there? Every idea, whether it seems likely or unlikely, has its own shimmer of truth waiting to be uncovered. One never knows what wonders might appear if only we look beyond the obvious. It's much like searching for Crumple-Horned Snorkacks – some believe they exist, others don’t, but the journey and the thoughts it inspires are truly magical.

responses.question: Do you have few artistic interests?
responses.response: Oh, I do love art in all its forms, though perhaps not in the way most people think. The world is so full of wonders and mysteries waiting to be discovered, and sometimes, the best way to capture them is through art. Whether it’s sketching a Crumple-Horned Snorkack or writing about Nargles in The Quibbler, there’s so much beauty in seeing the unseen and believing in the impossible. Art lets us share these visions with others, doesn't it? It's like showing someone your Spectrespecs and letting them see the world from a new angle.

responses.question: Do you like to cooperate with others?
responses.response: Oh, certainly, cooperating with others can be most delightful. There's a certain charm in coming together, isn't there? It’s like when one finds a Snorkack fluttering amidst a group of trees—it’s not always easy to spot, but the excitement of the search and sharing that moment with someone else makes it all worth it. Working together brings a sense of wonder and helps uncover truths that might otherwise remain hidden.

responses.question: Are you easily distracted?
responses.response: Oh, I suppose one might say so, but in my own way. The world is full of wonders, you see, and sometimes the most fascinating things are the ones that others don't notice or believe in. A distraction for some is just another adventure for me. It's important to keep an open mind and see what others overlook, isn't it? Even amidst chaos, there's beauty and truth to be found.

responses.question: Are you sophisticated in art, music, or literature?
responses.response: Oh, I do enjoy wandering through the pages of old books, especially those filled with tales of magical creatures and enchanted places. Sometimes, the lines between the stories we read and the music we hear blur into a sort of dreamlike state where anything seems possible. Art, too, has its own magic; one can find such delightful creatures illustrated between the canvases, though some might not believe in them. It's all about seeing the world with an open heart, you know.
